meanings.definition: To remove from use as legal tender.
meanings.sent1: The old coins were demonetized and could no longer be used to buy things.
meanings.sent2: The government demonetized the outdated currency to introduce new bills.
meanings.sent3: When the magician demonetized the coins, they turned into tiny pebbles!
meanings.sent4: Her outdated fashion sense was demonetized by the trendy new styles.
meanings.sent5: The decision to demonetize the old currency was met with mixed reactions from the public.

meanings.definition: To deprive of value or status.
meanings.sent1: The scandal demonetized his once-pristine reputation in the community.
meanings.sent2: The poor quality of the product demonetized its market value.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon demonetized the shiny new toy by chewing on it.
meanings.sent4: Her careless actions demonetized her chances of winning the competition.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected turn of events demonetized all his efforts to impress his boss.
